intro: Riedelia branderhorstii, commonly known as the Brandehorst's riedelia, is a rare and striking plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to red. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern.
